last_episode_to_air.name: The Irresistible Rise of Alan B'Stard
last_episode_to_air.overview: With his fortunes falling in Europe, Alan tries to get himself appointed to a government post back in England.

name: The New Statesman
overview: The New Statesman is a British sitcom of the late 1980s and early 1990s satirising the Conservative government of the time.

episodes.name: Happiness is a Warm Gun
episodes.overview: Alan is blackmailed into passing a bill arming the police.

episodes.name: Passport to Freedom
episodes.overview: Alan tries to ruin a company of which Sarah has just inherited shares.

episodes.name: Sex is Wrong
episodes.overview: Alan impersonates Sir Steven, leader of the Campaign for Moral Regeneration.

episodes.name: Waste Not, Want Not
episodes.overview: Alan secretly has to move 1000 gallons of toxic waste.

episodes.name: Friends of St. James
episodes.overview: Alan tries to get investors for a Caribbean bank.

episodes.name: Three Line Whipping
episodes.overview: Alan misses an important vote then appears on TV AM without knowing the result.

episodes.name: Baa Baa Black Sheep
episodes.overview: Alan's tries to get an American businessman to build a fast food factory in Haltemprice.

episodes.name: Fatal Extraction
episodes.overview: Alan finds oil on public lands then tries to buy it from a Labour Party leader.

episodes.name: Live from Westminster
episodes.overview: Televised debates turns Alan into a media superstar

episodes.name: A Wapping Conspiracy
episodes.overview: Alan is accused of fraternizing with teenaged girls.

episodes.name: The Haltemprice Bunker
episodes.overview: Alan needs publicity so he annonunces that he has found a Nazi.

episodes.name: California Here I Come
episodes.overview: Alan tries to sell a sitcom to an American producer, but Piers has to bail Alan out of jail first.

episodes.name: May the Best Man Win
episodes.overview: Alan tries to sabotage Piers' wedding.

episodes.name: Piers of the Realm
episodes.overview: Alan files for divorce.  Piers gets promoted.

episodes.name: Labour of Love
episodes.overview: A new MP threatens Alan's status as the most right-wing member of   Commons.

episodes.name: The Party's Over
episodes.overview: Alan tries to help the Labour party win the next election so he can blame them for the impending oil shortage.

episodes.name: Let Them Sniff Cake
episodes.overview: Alan upsets animal rights activists. A old friend wants a birthday ""cake"" from Alan.

episodes.name: Keeping Mum
episodes.overview: Alan's mum visits and threatens to stay forever unless Alan repeals his new bill abolishing social security.

episodes.name: Natural Selection
episodes.overview: At his annual cocktail party, Alan upsets a local VIP who threatens to take over his seat in the House.

episodes.name: Profit of Boom
episodes.overview: MI5 and the KGB ask Alan to start a new cold war because they no longer have anyone to spy on.

episodes.name: Back from the Mort
episodes.overview: Having survived imprisonment at hard labour in a Russian gulag, Alan attempts a return to politics by joining the European Parliament as representative from an obscure part of East Germany.

episodes.name: H*A*S*H
episodes.overview: Alan is worried that European drug lords may interfere with his attempt to make a profit from the forthcoming legalization of marijuana.

episodes.name: Speaking in Tongues
episodes.overview: Alan schemes to make some illicit profits from the translators who work for the EC.

episodes.name: Heil and Farewell
episodes.overview: Alan tries to take over leadership of a neo-Nazi organization.

episodes.name: A Bigger Splash
episodes.overview: Alan tries to become a war profiteer by arranging shipments of aid to Bosnia.

episodes.name: The Irresistible Rise of Alan B'Stard
episodes.overview: With his fortunes falling in Europe, Alan tries to get himself appointed to a government post back in England.
